byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu and Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Maher Samaan from Beirut, Lebanon.

abstract: Kurdish militias and rebel fighters gain control of Tal Abyad, Syrian town in which Islamic State was using to smuggle in fighters and supplies.
lead_paragraph: Kurdish rebel fighters, helped by American-led airstrikes, took the town of Tal Abyad, which ISIS had used to smuggle in fighters and supplies.

headline.main: ISIS Loses Control of Crucial Syrian Border Town
headline.print_headline: Kurds and Syrian Rebels Seize Rest of Town From ISIS

snippet: Kurdish rebel fighters, helped by American-led airstrikes, took the town of Tal Abyad, which ISIS had used to smuggle in fighters and supplies.
